Analysis

October 14, 2024

Analysis.Rmd

Metric conversions:

EIR to infective biting rates

The daily EIR is related to human blood feeding by infective mosquitoes in patches by the formula:

E=β⋅fqZE = \beta \cdot fqZ

Where EE is a vector of length NhN_h, fqZfqZ is a vector of length NpN_p, and so β\beta is a Np×NhN_p \times N_h matrix. We note that

fqZ=(βT⋅β)−1⋅βT⋅EfqZ = \left(\beta^T \cdot \beta \right)^{-1} \cdot \beta^T \cdot E

EIR and Exposure

The daily FoI is a function of the daily EIR and the

h=Fh(E,b,…)h = F_h(E, b, \ldots)

and the

α=Fα(E,b,t,…)\alpha = F_\alpha(E, b, t, \ldots)

In the Poisson case, h=bEh = bE so E=h/b,E = h/b, and

α=1−e−bE \alpha = 1 - e^{-bE} so

E=−ln(1−α)bE = \frac{-\ln(1-\alpha)}{b}

Developed by David L. Smith.
